entries.text: Hi my name is John. Can I ask who I’m speaking with today?
Great, “thanks Jane. Before we get started I need to confirm your identity so that I can access your account. I’ll be sending a passcode to your smartphone, can you read off the code you received?
Great, I’ve authenticated it’s you and I can access your account.
I see that you recently had an order fail due to an issue processing your credit card payment, is that why you’re calling today?
Exactly! I don’t understand why my Chase Visa card isn’t working? It worked just fine on Amazon earlier today.
I see, have you checked to see if you have enough funds in your account to cover the entire charge? I show the amount as 165.45$.
Are you kidding? Of course I have enough credit, that’s a ridiculous question!
I don’t appreciate you implying that I don’t have the money to make the purchase. I want to talk to your supervisor!
I’m sorry for that Jane. I can certainly get a supervisor. However, if you want I could offer you an account credit and we could try reprocessing the payment over the phone?
I suppose that would be fine.
Great. I’ll take a note to issue the credit after our call.
Let’s try running the transaction again, do you mind holding for a few minutes?
I’m back and I’ve confirmed that the transaction has gone through.
Is there anything else I can help you with today?
No, that’s it. Thank you for your help.
My pleasure! Enjoy the rest of your day.
